member.name: M:CMS.IO.AbstractDirectory.EnumerateDirectories(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of directory names in a specified path.
member.param: The relative or absolute path to the directory to search. This string is not case-sensitive.
member.returns: An enumerable collection of the full names (including paths) for the directories in the directory specified by .

remarks.para: This method is identical to with the asterisk (*) specified as the search pattern, so it returns all subdirectories.
If you need to search subdirectories recursively, use the method, which enables you to specify a search of all subdirectories.

member.name: T:CMS.IO.FileAccess
member.summary: File access options.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAccess.Read
member.summary: Read access to the file. Data can be read from the file. Combine with Write for read/write access.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAccess.Write
member.summary: Write access to the file. Data can be written to the file. Combine with Read for read/write access.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAccess.ReadWrite
member.summary: Read and write access to the file. Data can be written to and read from the file.

member.name: T:CMS.IO.FileAttributes
member.summary: Provides attributes for files and directories.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.ReadOnly
member.summary: The file is read-only.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Hidden
member.summary: The file is hidden, and thus is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.System
member.summary: The file is a system file. The file is part of the operating system or is used exclusively by the operating system.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Directory
member.summary: The file is a directory.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Archive
member.summary: The file's archive status. Applications use this attribute to mark files for backup or removal.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Device
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Normal
member.summary: The file is normal and has no other attributes set. This attribute is valid only if used alone.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Temporary
member.summary: The file is temporary. File systems attempt to keep all of the data in memory for quicker access rather than flushing the data back to mass storage. A temporary file should be deleted by the application as soon as it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.SparseFile
member.summary: The file is a sparse file. Sparse files are typically large files whose data are mostly zeros.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.ReparsePoint
member.summary: The file contains a reparse point, which is a block of user-defined data associated with a file or a directory.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Compressed
member.summary: The file is compressed.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Offline
member.summary: The file is offline. The data of the file is not immediately available.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.NotContentIndexed
member.summary: The file will not be indexed by the operating system's content indexing service.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileAttributes.Encrypted
member.summary: The file or directory is encrypted. For a file, this means that all data in the file is encrypted. For a directory, this means that encryption is the default for newly created files and directories.

member.name: T:CMS.IO.FileMode
member.summary: Specifies how the operating system should open a file.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.CreateNew
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new file. This requires System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Write. If the file already exists, an System.IO.IOException is thrown.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.Create
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should create a new file. If the file already exists, it will be overwritten. This requires System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Write. System.IO.FileMode.Create is equivalent to requesting that if the file does not exist, use System.IO.FileMode.CreateNew; otherwise, use System.IO.FileMode.Truncate.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.Open
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open an existing file. The ability to open the file is dependent on the value specified by System.IO.FileAccess. A System.IO.FileNotFoundException is thrown if the file does not exist.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.OpenOrCreate
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open a file if it exists; otherwise, a new file should be created. If the file is opened with FileAccess.Read, System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Read is required. If the file access is FileAccess.Write then System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Write is required. If the file is opened with FileAccess.ReadWrite, both System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Read and System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Write are required. If the file access is FileAccess.Append, then System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Append is required.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.Truncate
member.summary: Specifies that the operating system should open an existing file. Once opened, the file should be truncated so that its size is zero bytes. This requires System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAccess.Write. Attempts to read from a file opened with Truncate cause an exception.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileMode.Append
member.summary: Opens the file if it exists and seeks to the end of the file, or creates a new file. FileMode.Append can only be used in conjunction with FileAccess.Write. Attempting to seek to a position before the end of the file will throw an System.IO.IOException and any attempt to read fails and throws an System.NotSupportedException.

member.name: T:CMS.IO.FileShare
member.summary: Enumeration for file sharing options.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.None
member.summary: Declines sharing of the current file. Any request to open the file (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.Read
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.Write
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.ReadWrite
member.summary: Allows subsequent opening of the file for reading or writing. If this flag is not specified, any request to open the file for reading or writing (by this process or another process) will fail until the file is closed. However, even if this flag is specified, additional permissions might still be needed to access the file.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.Delete
member.summary: Allows subsequent deleting of a file.

member.name: F:CMS.IO.FileShare.Inheritable
member.summary: Makes the file handle inheritable by child processes. This is not directly supported by Win32.
